org.dgfoundation.amp.nireports.runtime

Interface VSplitStrategy

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    CurrencySplittingStrategy

    public interface VSplitStrategy
    an interface which governs the way a column is split vertically: 1. generating subclasses 2. mapping individual cells to subclasses 3. specifying the behaviour of generated CellColumns

    • Method Summary

      • getTotalSubcolumnName

        default ComparableValue<java.lang.String> getTotalSubcolumnName()
        returns the category name of the Total subcolumn. If returns null, no Total subcolumn exists. A Total subcolumn gets all the cells of the original column. Thus the result of the split would be to have cat1 | cat2 | ... | catn subcolumns + a "Total" subcolumn containing the reunion of the cells in the natural subcategories. By default there is no subtotals column, thus the default implementation of this function returns null
        Parameters:
        engine - the context
        Returns:

      • getEmptyTotalSubcolumnName

        default ComparableValue<java.lang.String> getEmptyTotalSubcolumnName()
        AMP-27773 returns the category name of the Total Empty subcolumn. If returns null, no Total Empty subcolumn exists. By default there is no subtotal empty column, thus the default implementation of this function returns null It is used for example for currency splitting, when it is needed to put empty total column in order to avoid hiding measures columns without data
        Parameters:
        engine - the context
        Returns:

        static VSplitStrategy build(java.util.function.Function<NiCell,ComparableValue<java.lang.String>> cat,
                            java.lang.String entityType)
        builds a VSplitStrategu which categorizes cells by a callback. Equivalent to calling #build(Function, String, null)

      • build

        static VSplitStrategy build(java.util.function.Function<NiCell,ComparableValue<java.lang.String>> cat,

        builds a VSplitStrategy which categorizes cells by a callback, while optionally sporting a "Total" subcolumn
        Parameters:
        cat -
        entityType -
        totalColumnNameSupplier - a supplier of the "total" subcolumn name. In case it is null, the strategy will not feature a Total subcolumn
        Returns:
